page.title: 04PORTHMADOG LANDSCAPE
page.content: The landscape of this area is varied. There is the urban area of{Porthmadog} -the focal point of the region -with its single long shopping street and rows of terraced houses branching off it.Along the coast of the estuaries can be found sandy beaches and coastal dunes which shift and change with the winter storms.Behind these on the SW are the deciduous oak woods of {Borth-y-Gest.}The{Porthmeirion peninsula to the east consists mainly of moorland with some rough pasture.Finally,behind the retaining wall of the{Cob}(the embankment across the Glaslyn estuary) is land reclaimed from the sea in the early 19th century. This still floods easily and is basically marshland. We are surrounded by Earth's beauty:moorland, woods,rocks,rivers,the estuaries and the sea.
